thread.title: Manchester City forward Leroy Sane apologises to punter after costing him â‚¬34,000 bet
thread.title_full: Manchester City forward Leroy Sane apologises to punter after costing him â‚¬34,000 bet

author: Callum Davis
title: Manchester City forward Leroy Sane apologises to punter after costing him â‚¬34,000 bet
text:
F or most people, Tuesday night's epic eight-goal thriller at the Etihad was one of the best Champions League games in recent memory. 
But for one unfortunate punter, Manchester City's dramatic 5-3 win over Monaco meant nothing but agonising heartbreak.
After John Stones had put Manchester City 4-3 to complete City's unlikely comeback, German fan Mustafa Celik was minutes away from winning a huge â‚¬34,000 bet.
Leroy Sane scores his second goal and Man City's fifth Credit: REX C elik had placed a correct score double on the two Champions League matches and with Atletico Madrid winning 4-2 away to Bayer Leverkusen he only needed Man City to hang on for a 4-3 win to pull off an unlikely win. 
However with less than 10 minutes left to play Sergio Aguero teed the ball up for Leroy Sane to get his second goal of the game and put pay to Celik's bet.
The German punter tweeted Sane, writing: "You owe me â‚¬34,000," along with a picture of his losing betting slip.
After reading about Celik's bet in the Wednesday morning newspapers the 19-year-old apologised for costing the punter a Â£28,000 win.
I read about it in the newspapers ... sorry for that poor guy ðŸ™ˆðŸ˜… #inSanÃ© pic.twitter.com/Kx6X87Gti3 
â€” Leroy SanÃ© (@LeroySane19) February 22, 2017 "I read about it in the newspapers. Sorry for that poor guy! #Insane."
P ep Guardiola lavished praise on his young players after securing an "amazing" comeback.
"Many things happened, but in some moments we were unlucky and lucky," Guardiola said after the match.
"It's not easy to play against them, the old guys played amazing, as did the young guys.
"This experience will help us. Monaco have more experience in Europe than us and we need this experience to improve. It's the first step. We have to score goals in Monaco but it was a good result."
